quotes.quote: Any advice which does not lead to self-improvement is misleading.
Organized religions by their very natures are misleading.
If we are leading but not closely following Christ, we are misleading.
Though analogy is often misleading, it is the least misleading thing we have.
Facts can be so misleading, where rumors, true or false, are often revealing.
The emotion of love gives all of us a misleading illusion of knowing the other.
The most misleading assumptions are the ones you don't even know you're making.
Lyrics are always misleading because they make people think that that's what the music is about.
One of the most misleading representational techniques in our language is the use of the word 'I.'
Fallacious and misleading arguments are most easily detected if set out in correct syllogistic form.
It is misleading in a crucial way to view information as something that can be poured into an empty vessel, like a fluid or even energy.
Obsolete misleading theologies bear the same relation to the essence of true religion that scarlet fever, mumps, and measles do to education.
There is a misleading, unwritten rule that states if a quote giving advice comes from someone famous, very old, or Greek, then it must be good advice.
Nothing is more misleading to the youth of a nation than to state the outcome immediately after the beginning as if nothing could have taken place in between.
It's misleading to suppose there's any basic difference between education & entertainment . This distinction merely relieves people of the responsibility of looking into the matter.
It is misleading to imagine that we are developed in spite of our circumstances, for we are developed because of them. It is mastery in circumstances that is needed, not mastery over them.
How often misused words generate misleading thoughts.
It's misleading to essentialize an entire society as if it were a single mind.
Misleading and deceiving people are addicted to a despair of longing to Death & Weakness. That's all.
Nothing could be more misleading than the idea that computer technology introduced the age of information. The printing press began that age, and we have not been free of it since.
A deceitful tongue will always be good at twisting the truth.
How deceitful hope may be, yet she carries us on pleasantly to the end of life.
Nothing is more deceitful than the appearance of humility. It is often only carelessness of opinion, and sometimes an indirect boast.
The deceitful misquoting of scientists to suit an anti-scientific agenda ranks among the many unchristian habits of fundamentalist authors.
False expectations take away joy.
A false tale often betrays itself.
False modesty is better than none.
False praise is worse than no praise.
False words do not bring forth fruit.
In a false quarrel there is no true valor.
